metadata.description: Detailed analyst-grade profiles of China's top 24 AI companies
metadata.valuation_note: Valuations are approximate, sourced from public market caps, IPO filings, and last known private funding rounds. All in billions CNY. null = not publicly available.
metadata.revenue_note: Revenue figures are 2024 full-year or latest available, in billions CNY. null = undisclosed.
metadata.sources: WebSearch aggregation from PitchBook, Crunchbase, Tracxn, company filings, financial press, Wikipedia

companies.name: DeepSeek
companies.key_products: DeepSeek-V3 foundation model, DeepSeek-R1 reasoning model, DeepSeek API platform, DeepSeek Chat app
companies.profile: Founded in May 2023 by Liang Wenfeng as a research lab within quantitative hedge fund High-Flyer Capital (幻方量化). DeepSeek stunned the AI world in January 2025 by releasing R1, a 671B-parameter open-source reasoning model trained on just 2,048 Nvidia H800 GPUs for $5.6 million, matching GPT-4-class performance at a fraction of the cost. The company operates without external venture funding, bankrolled entirely by High-Flyer's trading profits. DeepSeek's radical cost efficiency triggered a global reassessment of AI economics and US chip export controls.
key_facts: R1 trained for $5.6M on 2,048 H800s, vs. billions spent by US labs
V3 scores 88.3 on MMLU, competitive with GPT-4o and Claude 3.5 Sonnet
57.2M+ app downloads globally by May 2025; 22.15M daily active users
Bloomberg estimated $155B valuation (Feb 2025), making it China's 3rd most valuable startup
$220M annual revenue run rate by mid-2025 from API and enterprise services

companies.name: Alibaba (Qwen / DAMO Academy)
companies.name_cn: 阿里巴巴 (通义千问 / 达摩院)
companies.key_products: Qwen LLM series, Alibaba Cloud AI, Tongyi Qianwen chatbot, ModelScope, DashScope API
companies.model_params: 480B MoE (35B activated) for Qwen3-Coder; 235B MoE (22B activated) for Qwen3 dense
companies.profile: Alibaba's DAMO Academy launched the Qwen (Tongyi Qianwen) model family, which has become the most downloaded open-source LLM series globally with 400M+ downloads and 140,000+ derivative models on Hugging Face. Alibaba Cloud holds 24.6% market share in China's AI public cloud, ranking #1 for two consecutive years. The company has invested aggressively in AI infrastructure, with AI-related cloud revenue growing at triple-digit rates for eight consecutive quarters.
key_facts: Qwen family: 400M+ downloads, 140,000+ derivative models built on top
#1 in China AI public cloud market share at 24.6% (IDC 2024)
AI-related cloud revenue growing at triple-digit rates for 8 consecutive quarters
Qwen3-Coder-480B released mid-2025 with 480B parameters (35B activated)
Total Alibaba revenue $137.3B USD (FY2025); cloud segment $3.64B/quarter

companies.name: Baidu
companies.key_products: ERNIE Bot (Wenxiaoyan) chatbot, ERNIE 5.0 omni-modal model, Baidu AI Cloud, Apollo autonomous driving, Qianfan platform
companies.profile: Baidu was China's first major tech company to launch a consumer LLM chatbot, debuting ERNIE Bot (Wenxin Yiyan) in March 2023. The model rapidly gained 300M users by June 2024. ERNIE 5.0, unveiled at Baidu World 2025, is a natively omni-modal model jointly modeling text, images, audio, and video. Baidu also operates Apollo Go, China's largest robotaxi fleet with 400+ vehicles in Wuhan alone. AI Cloud infrastructure revenue reached RMB 4.2B in Q3 2025, up 33% YoY.
key_facts: ERNIE Bot reached 300M users by June 2024, China's first major LLM chatbot
AI Cloud infrastructure revenue RMB 4.2B in Q3 2025, up 33% YoY
AI-native marketing revenue surged 262% YoY to RMB 2.8B in Q3 2025
Apollo Go operates 400+ robotaxis in Wuhan covering 1,160 sq miles
31,000 employees at Baidu Core as of September 2025

companies.name: ByteDance (Doubao)
companies.key_products: Doubao AI assistant, Volcano Engine cloud AI, Doubao 1.5 Pro LLM, Seedance video model, TikTok, Douyin
companies.profile: ByteDance entered the LLM race aggressively through its Seed research team (~1,500 researchers) and Volcano Engine enterprise arm. Doubao surpassed DeepSeek to become China's most-used AI app with 157M MAUs (August 2025) and 100M+ DAUs by late 2025, making it the #4 generative AI app globally. ByteDance's AI infrastructure spending is staggering, with ~$23B capex budgeted for 2026. Volcano Engine generated RMB 12B revenue in 2024 and is expected to roughly double to RMB 25B in 2025.
key_facts: Doubao: 157M MAUs, 100M+ DAUs, China's most-used AI app
Average daily token processing: 50 trillion tokens (up from 4T in Dec 2024)
Volcano Engine AI revenue: RMB 12B in 2024, ~RMB 25B projected 2025
AI capex budget: ~$23B for 2026, including potential 20,000 Nvidia H200 purchase
Company valuation exceeded $330B in August 2025 buyback

companies.name: Zhipu AI
companies.key_products: GLM-5 foundation model, ChatGLM chatbot, Z.ai platform, MaaS API, AutoGLM agent
companies.profile: Spun out of Tsinghua University's Knowledge Engineering Group, Zhipu AI is one of China's most academically rooted AI startups. The company completed its Hong Kong IPO on January 8, 2026, under ticker 2513, achieving a post-money valuation exceeding HK$51 billion. GLM-5, released in 2025, offers 745B total parameters with 44B active per inference. Zhipu raised over RMB 8.3B across eight pre-IPO rounds from backers including Alibaba, Tencent, and Meituan.
key_facts: Hong Kong IPO on Jan 8, 2026 at HK$51B+ valuation (ticker: 2513)
GLM-5: 745B total parameters, 44B activated per inference
Raised RMB 8.3B+ ($1.14B) across 8 pre-IPO funding rounds
Backed by Alibaba, Tencent, Meituan, Ant Group, Xiaomi, HongShan
883 employees; spun from Tsinghua University's Knowledge Engineering Group

companies.name: Moonshot AI
companies.key_products: Kimi AI chat assistant, Kimi K2.5 multimodal model, Kimi API, MoonViT vision encoder
companies.model_params: 1T MoE (32B activated) for K2; K2.5 adds MoonViT 400M vision encoder
companies.profile: Founded in March 2023 by Yang Zhilin, a former Google Brain researcher, Moonshot AI differentiated itself from the start with long-context capability, claiming 2 million Chinese characters in a single prompt by March 2024. Despite having only ~80 employees, Moonshot generated $240M revenue by November 2025. Kimi K2, released July 2025, features a 1 trillion parameter MoE architecture trained for approximately $4.6M, and K2.5 added native vision through MoonViT.
key_facts: Kimi K2: 1T parameter MoE model trained for ~$4.6M
Only ~80 employees yet generated $240M revenue by November 2025
Raised $500M Series C at $4.3B post-money valuation (end 2025)
Long-context pioneer: 2M Chinese character context window (March 2024)
Founded by Yang Zhilin, ex-Google Brain; backed by Alibaba, Tencent, IDG Capital

companies.name: MiniMax
companies.key_products: MiniMax-Text-01 LLM, MiniMax-VL-01 multimodal model, Talkie consumer AI app, Hailuo AI video generator
companies.profile: MiniMax, founded in December 2021, built both foundation models and consumer AI applications in parallel. Its Talkie app (AI companion chatbot) reached 29.77M MAUs by December 2024, while Hailuo became one of China's most popular AI video generators. MiniMax-Text-01, released January 2025, features 456B parameters and a 4M token context window, outperforming Google's Gemini 2.0 Flash on MMLU and SimpleQA benchmarks. The company filed for a Hong Kong IPO targeting a $4B+ valuation.
key_facts: MiniMax-Text-01: 456B parameters with 4M token context window
Talkie app: 29.77M MAUs (December 2024)
Over 50,000 global enterprise customers
Hong Kong IPO filed, targeting $4B+ valuation; raised $850M total
Outperforms Gemini 2.0 Flash on MMLU and SimpleQA benchmarks

companies.name: 01.AI
companies.key_products: Yi series open-source LLMs, Yi-Lightning, Yi-VL multimodal models, Wanzhi enterprise platform
companies.model_params: Undisclosed (Yi-34B was the original open-source model; Yi-Lightning is newer)
companies.profile: Founded in March 2023 by Kai-Fu Lee, the renowned AI scientist and former head of Google China, 01.AI reached unicorn status ($1B+ valuation) within just eight months. The company released Yi-34B as its first open-source model in November 2023, outperforming Meta's LLaMA 2-70B on key benchmarks despite being much smaller. Yi-Lightning, released October 2024, ranked joint third globally alongside xAI's Grok-2 in UC Berkeley's LMSYS rankings. In 2025, 01.AI pivoted toward enterprise with Wanzhi and formed a joint lab with Alibaba.
key_facts: Reached $1B unicorn status in 8 months, one of the fastest in AI history
Yi-Lightning ranked joint 3rd globally in LMSYS rankings (Oct 2024)
Yi-34B outperformed Meta LLaMA 2-70B at half the parameters
Founded by Kai-Fu Lee (ex-Google China, ex-Microsoft, ex-Apple)
Joint research lab formed with Alibaba in February 2025

companies.name: StepFun
companies.key_products: Step-1 and Step-2 language models, Step-1.5V multimodal model, terminal AI solutions for Honor/Oppo/ZTE
companies.model_params: 1T+ parameters (China's first trillion-parameter model by a startup)
companies.profile: Founded in April 2023 by Jiang Daxin, former chief scientist of Microsoft Research Asia, StepFun has moved fast to build China's first trillion-parameter language model from a startup. The company released 11 self-developed base models since launching its Step series in March 2024, spanning language and multimodal capabilities. In January 2026, StepFun closed its B+ round at RMB 5B+ ($718M), the largest single AI financing round in China in 12 months, led by Shanghai state-backed funds with Tencent and Hong Kong Investment Corporation participating.
key_facts: B+ round raised RMB 5B+ ($718M), largest China AI round in 12 months (Jan 2026)
Step-2: China's first trillion-parameter model from a startup (July 2024)
11 self-developed base models released since March 2024
Founded by Jiang Daxin, ex-chief scientist of Microsoft Research Asia
Investors include Shanghai State-owned Capital, Tencent, Hong Kong Investment Corp

companies.name: Baichuan AI
companies.key_products: Baichuan 4 LLM, Baichuan-M1-Preview medical reasoning model, Baichuan series open-source models
companies.profile: Founded on April 10, 2023 by Wang Xiaochuan, the former CEO of search engine Sogou (acquired by Tencent in 2021), Baichuan AI drew from deep NLP expertise to rapidly release a family of open-source Chinese LLMs. The company completed a massive RMB 5B Series A in July 2024, valuing it at RMB 20B. In March 2025, Baichuan pivoted to specialize in AI for healthcare, launching Baichuan-M1-Preview, a multimodal foundation model for medical reasoning, reflecting a strategic bet on vertical AI applications.
key_facts: RMB 5B Series A completed July 2024 at RMB 20B valuation ($2.8B USD)
Founded by Wang Xiaochuan, ex-CEO of Sogou (search engine acquired by Tencent)
Pivoted to healthcare AI specialization in March 2025
Baichuan-M1-Preview: multimodal medical reasoning model (Jan 2025)
Raised $1.04B total across 4 rounds; backed by Alibaba, Tencent, Xiaomi

companies.name: SenseTime
companies.key_products: SenseNova LLM platform, SenseCore AI infrastructure, smart city solutions, smart auto ADAS, AI healthcare
companies.profile: SenseTime is the most prominent of China's 'Four AI Dragons' in computer vision, and has successfully pivoted toward generative AI. Originally founded in 2014 from the Chinese University of Hong Kong by Prof. Tang Xiaoou, SenseTime listed on the HKEX in December 2021. By H1 2025, generative AI accounted for 77% of total revenue, reaching RMB 1.815B, up 73% YoY. The company operates under a '1+X' strategy where generative AI and CV form the core, with smart auto, healthcare, home robotics, and retail as growth verticals.
key_facts: Generative AI: 77% of revenue in H1 2025, RMB 1.815B (+73% YoY)
Total revenue RMB 2.358B in H1 2025, up 35.6% YoY
Market cap ~HKD 80.8B ($10.9B USD) as of late 2025
3,206 employees; listed HKEX December 2021
'1+X' strategy: core GenAI/CV + smart auto, healthcare, robotics, retail verticals

companies.name: Megvii (Face++)
companies.key_products: Face++ facial recognition platform, MegEngine deep learning framework, smart logistics solutions, AIoT cameras
companies.profile: Founded in 2011 by three Tsinghua University graduates (Yin Qi, Tang Wenbin, Yang Mu), Megvii launched Face++ as China's first online facial recognition platform in 2012, which became a standard for identity verification across Chinese fintech and security. The company raised $1.4B but its IPO attempts failed repeatedly: a Hong Kong filing in 2019 was complicated by US entity list sanctions, and its STAR Market application was ultimately withdrawn in November 2024. Co-founder Yin Qi departed in 2025 to join StepFun as chairman, signaling a leadership transition.
key_facts: Face++ was China's first online facial recognition platform (2012)
Raised $1.4B total across multiple rounds; last valued at $4B (2019)
Added to US Entity List; IPO applications failed in HK and STAR Market
Revenue reached RMB 1.42B in 2018 (359% CAGR from 2016)
Co-founder Yin Qi left in 2025 to become chairman of StepFun

companies.name: CloudWalk Technology
companies.key_products: Facial recognition terminals, intelligent customer service platform, smart city AI platform, banking AI solutions
companies.profile: CloudWalk was founded in April 2015 by Zhou Xi, a graduate of the University of Science and Technology of China with a background in pattern recognition, after his departure from the Chinese Academy of Sciences. The company went public on the STAR Market in May 2022 and serves over 400 financial institutions in China, including six major commercial banks (ICBC, Bank of China, CCB). CloudWalk has increasingly expanded from facial recognition into broader AI platform capabilities for smart governance and smart finance.
key_facts: STAR Market IPO in May 2022 (ticker: 688327)
Serves 400+ financial institutions including ICBC, Bank of China, CCB
Q3 2025 revenue: RMB 355M, up 56.81% YoY
Founded from Chinese Academy of Sciences AI research
Focus areas: smart finance, smart governance, smart transportation

companies.name: Yitu Technology
companies.key_products: Medical AI diagnostics, facial recognition systems, NLP platforms, QuestCore AI chip, public security AI
companies.profile: Co-founded in 2012 by Leo Zhu (PhD statistics, UCLA; postdoc MIT AI Lab) and Lin Chenxi (former Alibaba Cloud architect), Yitu became one of China's 'Four AI Dragons' alongside SenseTime, Megvii, and CloudWalk. The company's medical AI published breakthrough diagnostic results in Nature Medicine, achieving 97% accuracy on acute asthma and 94% on influenza detection from electronic health records. Yitu's STAR Market IPO was voluntarily terminated in March 2021, and the company was added to the US Department of Defense's 'Chinese Military Companies' list in January 2024.
key_facts: Nature Medicine publication: AI diagnostics achieving 97% accuracy on acute asthma
Raised $385M total from Sequoia Capital, Hillhouse, Gaorong Capital
Last known valuation ~$3.5B; IPO withdrawn from STAR Market (March 2021)
Named on US DoD 'Chinese Military Companies' list (January 2024)
70% of 2024 revenue from direct sales to businesses and governments

companies.name: Pony.ai
companies.key_products: Gen-7 Robotaxi, L4 autonomous driving system, autonomous trucking solutions
companies.profile: Pony.ai, founded in 2016, became one of the first Chinese autonomous driving companies to achieve dual US/HK listing, with its NASDAQ IPO in November 2024 raising $260M and its HKEX listing following in November 2025. The company achieved a landmark milestone when its Gen-7 Robotaxis reached city-wide unit economics breakeven in Guangzhou, with daily average orders hitting 232 per vehicle. Pony.ai plans to scale its fleet past 3,000 vehicles by end of 2026, up from 961 as of Q3 2025.
key_facts: NASDAQ IPO November 2024 raising $260M; HKEX dual listing November 2025
Gen-7 Robotaxi achieved city-wide unit economics breakeven in Guangzhou
Q3 2025 revenue: $25.4M, up 72% YoY; fare-charging revenue up 200%+ YoY
Fleet: 961 vehicles (667 Gen-7); targeting 3,000+ by end 2026
Market cap ~$7.07B USD

companies.name: WeRide
companies.key_products: Robotaxi, Robobus, Robovan, Robosweeper, ADAS solutions
companies.profile: WeRide, founded in 2017 by Tony Han (former chief scientist of Baidu's autonomous driving unit), became the world's first publicly listed universal autonomous driving technology company when it IPO'd on NASDAQ in October 2024. The company holds autonomous driving licenses in China, UAE, Singapore, and the US simultaneously, a unique global breadth. WeRide has conducted testing and operations across 30 cities in seven countries with 1,700+ days of operation.
key_facts: World's first publicly listed universal autonomous driving company (NASDAQ Oct 2024)
Autonomous driving licenses in 4 countries: China, UAE, Singapore, US
Operations across 30 cities in 7 countries; 1,700+ days of operation
Dual NASDAQ/HKEX listing; HKEX secondary listing November 2025
Market cap ~$3.03B USD; 3,093 employees

companies.name: Momenta
companies.key_products: End-to-end autonomous driving software, ADAS solutions for OEMs, intelligent driving large model
companies.profile: Founded in September 2016 by Cao Xudong, a former scientist at Microsoft Research and ex-R&D director at SenseTime, Momenta builds autonomous driving 'brains' for automakers rather than manufacturing vehicles itself. The company has assembled perhaps the most impressive roster of OEM partnerships in China's AD space: Toyota, Mercedes-Benz, BMW, BYD, Nissan, Honda, and Uber. Momenta confidentially filed for a Hong Kong IPO in late 2025 after its NYSE listing approval expired, seeking a ~$6B valuation.
key_facts: OEM partnerships: Toyota, Mercedes-Benz, BMW, BYD, Nissan, Honda, Uber
Raised $1.42B total across 9 rounds from 34 investors
Targeting ~$6B valuation in Hong Kong IPO (filed late 2025)
BYD joint venture DiPi Intelligent Mobility (established 2021)
GAC Toyota deploying Momenta full-scenario smart driving in bZ3X

companies.name: UBTECH Robotics
companies.key_products: Walker S2 industrial humanoid robot, educational robots, patrol robots, commercial service robots
companies.profile: Founded in 2012 by Zhou Jian, UBTECH became the world's first humanoid robot company listed on a major stock exchange when it IPO'd on the HKEX in December 2023. The Walker S2 humanoid robot, standing 1.76m tall with 52 degrees of freedom, is one of the first humanoids capable of true 24/7 autonomous operation via a battery-swap system. UBTECH began mass production and delivery of Walker S2 in 2025, with cumulative orders exceeding RMB 1.1 billion and a target to produce 5,000 units in 2026.
key_facts: First humanoid robot company listed on HKEX (December 2023)
Walker S2: 1.76m tall, 52 degrees of freedom, 24/7 autonomous battery-swap
Cumulative Walker orders exceeded RMB 1.1B (~$153M) in 2025
Revenue RMB 1.31B in 2024, up 23.65% YoY
Target: 5,000 humanoid units in 2026 (10x from 2025 output of 500)

companies.name: DJI
companies.key_products: Consumer drones (Mavic, Mini, Air series), agricultural drones (Agras), enterprise drones, LiDAR sensors, gimbal systems, Robomaster educational robots
companies.profile: DJI, founded in 2006 by Frank Wang (Wang Tao) in a Shenzhen dorm room, dominates global consumer drones with 70-90% market share depending on the segment. The company crossed RMB 50B in revenue in 2024 with a net profit margin approaching 40%, nearly twice Apple's. DJI remains stubbornly private despite years of IPO speculation, and has never conducted a formal public funding round since raising ~$1B in 2018. DJI's AI capabilities span autonomous flight, computer vision, obstacle avoidance, LiDAR mapping, and agricultural AI.
key_facts: Revenue exceeded RMB 50B ($7B+ USD) in 2024, up 35% YoY
Net profit margin approaching 40%, nearly twice Apple's
70-90% global consumer drone market share
14,000 employees; remains private despite IPO speculation since 2018
Estimated valuation: $15-25B USD depending on methodology

companies.name: iFlytek
companies.key_products: iFlytek Spark LLM (Xinghuo), voice recognition platform, AI education solutions, AI healthcare, smart office products
companies.profile: iFlytek, established in 1999 as a spin-out from the University of Science and Technology of China (USTC) in Hefei, is China's undisputed leader in voice AI and speech recognition. The partially state-owned company expanded into LLMs with Spark (Xinghuo), upgraded to 4.0 Turbo in October 2024 and followed by the reasoning-focused X1 model in January 2025. iFlytek's revenue reached RMB 23.3B in 2024, up 18.8% YoY, with AI deployed across 813 application scenarios spanning education, healthcare, smart city, and judiciary.
key_facts: China's #1 voice AI company; partially state-owned
Revenue RMB 23.3B in 2024, up 18.8% YoY; H1 2025 crossed RMB 10B
17,550 employees; market cap ~RMB 115B ($16B USD)
Spark LLM claimed to outperform ChatGPT in Chinese language tasks
AI deployed in 813 scenarios across education, healthcare, judiciary, and smart city

companies.name: Cambricon Technologies
companies.key_products: Siyuan 590 AI training chip, Siyuan 690 (next-gen), MLU cloud inference accelerators
companies.profile: Founded in 2016 by brothers Chen Tianshi (CEO) and Chen Yunji, both prodigies who entered university as teenagers, Cambricon became China's most valuable pure-play AI chip company. Listed on the STAR Market in July 2020, its stock surpassed the RMB 1,000 mark, a threshold previously breached only by Kweichow Moutai in A-share history. Revenue surged 4,300% YoY in H1 2025 to RMB 2.88B, delivering its first-ever profit of RMB 1.04B. The company invests heavily in R&D, spending ~91% of revenue on chip development.
key_facts: Market cap exceeded RMB 500B (~$70B USD) by early 2025
Revenue surged 4,300% YoY in H1 2025 to RMB 2.88B; first-ever profit of RMB 1.04B
Stock price breached RMB 1,000, only 2nd A-share company after Kweichow Moutai
R&D spending: ~RMB 1.07B in 2024, approximately 91% of revenue
Founded by Chen brothers: entered university as teenagers, both AI chip pioneers

companies.name: Horizon Robotics
companies.key_products: Journey series automotive AI chips, Horizon SuperDrive autonomous driving solution, Horizon Pilot ADAS, Horizon Mono
companies.profile: Founded in 2015 by Yu Kai, former head of Baidu's self-driving car division, Horizon Robotics is the leading third-party provider of automotive ADAS/AD chips in China with 40% market share in domestic OEM electric vehicles. The Journey chip series, starting from Journey 1.0 in December 2017, was the first automotive AI chip made by a Chinese company. Horizon IPO'd on the HKEX in October 2024 raising $696M, and its market cap has since grown to HKD 121-136B. Revenue reached HKD 3.3B with profits of HKD 2.42B in the last twelve months.
key_facts: 40% market share in China's domestic OEM EV ADAS/AD chip market
HKEX IPO October 2024 raised $696M; market cap HKD 121-136B
Journey series: first Chinese-made automotive AI chip (Journey 1.0, Dec 2017)
Revenue HKD 3.3B and profit HKD 2.42B in trailing twelve months
Backed by Intel, BYD, Chery, CATL, Alibaba, Baidu

companies.name: Enflame Technology
companies.key_products: CloudBlazer T20/T21 AI training accelerators, S60 inference accelerator, L600 training chip (FP8), CloudBlazer POD computing cluster
companies.profile: Founded in March 2018 by two former AMD employees, Enflame develops cloud AI training and inference GPGPUs that have become a key domestic alternative to Nvidia chips. Tencent is both a major investor (owning 20.26%) and the anchor customer, deploying Enflame's CloudBlazer T20/T21 accelerators for AI workloads. Enflame filed for a STAR Market IPO in January 2026 seeking to raise RMB 6B, with a pre-IPO valuation of approximately RMB 20.5B. One report values the company as a '16 billion super unicorn' created by Tencent.
key_facts: STAR Market IPO filed Jan 2026 to raise RMB 6B; Tencent owns 20.26%
Pre-IPO valuation ~RMB 20.5B ($2.8B USD); some reports cite RMB 116B
Raised $1.39B total across multiple rounds
L600 chip (2025): FP8 support for faster, cheaper large model training
Key customer: Tencent deploys CloudBlazer T20/T21 for AI training workloads

companies.name: Biren Technology
companies.key_products: BR100 general-purpose GPU, BR104 inference GPU, cloud AI computing solutions
companies.profile: Founded in 2019 by Zhang Wen (former president at SenseTime) and Jiao Guofang (ex-Huawei), Biren gained attention by launching the BR100 GPU in 2022, claiming performance comparable to Nvidia's H100. However, US sanctions in October 2022 forced TSMC to halt manufacturing of Biren's chips, and the company was added to the US Entity List in October 2023. Despite these setbacks, Biren completed its Hong Kong IPO on January 2, 2026, raising up to $624M with support from 23 cornerstone investors. Its chips are deployed in China Mobile and China Telecom intelligent computing centers.
key_facts: Hong Kong IPO January 2, 2026; raised up to $624M; shares surged 76% on debut
BR100 GPU: claimed Nvidia H100-class performance at launch (2022)
US Entity List since October 2023; TSMC forced to halt chip manufacturing
23 cornerstone IPO investors including Qiming, Ping An, UBS
Deployed in China Mobile and China Telecom intelligent computing centers
